titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to provide for four-year terms for Representatives and to limit the number of terms Representatives may serve.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

bill.summary: 1/5/1993--Introduced. Constitutional Amendment - Provides for staggered four-year terms for Members of the House of Representatives. Prohibits persons from being elected to the House more than four times or more than three times to four-year terms.
